add_transaction_type_flag(type_col='TransactionType')[source]¶

Converts ‘Income’ / ‘Expense’ to binary flag.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing the transaction type column.

  • type_col (str) – Name of the transaction type column in the DataFrame.

Returns:

DataFrame with an additional column ‘IsIncome’ where ‘Income’ is 1 and ‘Expense’ is 0.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

clean_amount_column(amount_col='Amount')[source]¶

Removes symbols, commas, and converts amount to float.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing the amount column.

  • amount_col (str) – Name of the amount column in the DataFrame.

Returns:

DataFrame with the cleaned amount column.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

date_features(date_col='Date')[source]¶

Extracts useful time-based features from the date.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing the date column.

  • date_col (str) – Name of the date column in the DataFrame.f

Returns:

DataFrame with additional time-based features.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

Adds the following features:

  • DayOfWeek: Numeric representation of the day of the week (0=Monday, 6=Sunday).

  • Day: Day of the month.

  • Month: Month of the year.

  • Year: Year of the date.

  • IsWeekend: Boolean indicating if the date falls on a weekend (Saturday or Sunday).

rolling_features(amount_col='Amount', date_col='Date')[source]¶

Adds rolling average/spending features based on amount.

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing the amount and date columns.

  • amount_col (str) – Name of the amount column in the DataFrame.

  • date_col (str) – Name of the date column in the DataFrame.

backend.data_pipeline.kaggle_loader module¶

class backend.data_pipeline.kaggle_loader.KaggleLoader(dataset_name: str, download_path: Path)[source]¶

Bases: object

This module provides functionality to download and unzip Kaggle datasets. It uses the Kaggle API to authenticate and download datasets specified by their Kaggle IDs.
